bibl.title: Glass Plaques from a Foundation Deposit at Canopus, Egypt.
bibl.note: British Museum, Reg. 1895, 10-30.2 and 3. Fragments of two glass plaques (originally about 17.1 cm. by 5.8 cm.), c. 246-221 B.C. One is blue, the other is green; both have probably borne ink inscriptions. They were found with the inscribed gold plaque mentioning Ptolemy III and Berenice (I.B.M. IV, 1063).
bibl.seg: Bailey Donald M., Glass Plaques from a Foundation Deposit at Canopus, Egypt.
